Dialogue: Hello, are you an adventurer like myself?
Ohh good, I have a contract that might be a bit over my head.
Answer0: I'm sure we can handle it.

Dialogue: There has been a manticore destroying the local livestock. I was hired to slay the beast, but I can't seem to find it.
Answer0: We have quite the opposite problem. While on the road manticores continually find our camp.

Dialogue: They're attracted to the smell of cooked meat. Lamb in particular.
That's an excellent idea, rather chasing the manticore, I'll lure it to me. As payment for your help would you rather have 100 talons or have me owe you a favor?
Answer1: A favor among friends is far more valuable.

Dialogue: That is usually the prefered payment. I wish you the best of luck, and hope to meet again
Answer0: Best of luck to you as well.

Dialogue: Ohh thank goodness, I don't have many talons left. I'll find some way to pay you back.
Answer0: I hope to see you again.

Dialogue: Well If you can help me I could perhaps pay a 100 talon consulting fee.
Answer0: Perhaps some advice, While on the road manticores continually find our camp.
Answer1: Sorry, we can't work for so little.

Dialogue: They're attracted to the smell of cooked meat. Lamb in particular.
Okay come back if you change your mind.
